pendulum v0.0.2.94

pendulum

Scott Chamberlain

2021-07-12

Source: vignettes/pendulum.Rmd
pendulum.Rmd

Time classes for R, w/ time mocking capability via timefuzz

library(pendulum)

clock

clock(2009)$time
#> [1] "2009-01-01 12:00:00 UTC"
clock(2009, 3, 13)$time
#> [1] "2009-03-13 12:00:00 UTC"
clock(2009, 3, 13, 1, 4, 53)$time
#> [1] "2009-03-13 01:04:53 UTC"
x <- clock(2009, 3, 13)
x$utc
#> [1] "2009-03-13 12:00:00 UTC"
x$date
#> [1] "2009-03-13"

now

now()$now()
#> [1] "2021-07-12 21:06:53 UTC"
now("UTC")$now()
#> [1] "2021-07-12 21:06:53 UTC"

sys_date

Mockable [Sys.Date()] drop in replacement. Uses now() internally so can be mocked as shown below.

Sys.Date()
#> [1] "2021-07-12"
sys_date()
#> [1] "2021-07-12"

sys_time

Mockable [Sys.time()] drop in replacement. Uses now() internally so can be mocked as shown below.

Sys.time()
#> [1] "2021-07-12 21:06:53 UTC"
sys_time()
#> [1] "2021-07-12 21:06:53 UTC"

use in a function

todays_date <- function() sys_time()
todays_date()
#> [1] "2021-07-12 21:06:53 UTC"

now let’s mock time

library(timefuzz)
x <- time_fuzz$new()
## set to today + 5 days
x$freeze(Sys.Date() + 5)
todays_date()
#> [1] "2021-07-17 UTC"
# if you run it again, you get the same EXACT time
todays_date()
#> [1] "2021-07-17 UTC"

“unfreeze” and you’re back to real time

x$unfreeze()
todays_date()
#> [1] "2021-07-12 21:06:53 UTC"
Sys.sleep(1)
todays_date()
#> [1] "2021-07-12 21:06:54 UTC"
Sys.sleep(1)
todays_date()
#> [1] "2021-07-12 21:06:55 UTC"
